decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to maintain control of the board by playing low-cost, efficient spells and creatures while applying pressure to the opponent. Through a combination of powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Delver of Secrets, along with versatile spells like Lightning Bolt and Force of Will, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while establishing its own threat. By utilizing countermagic, card draw, and tempo plays, this Aggro - Canadian Threshold deck seeks to win the game quickly and decisively.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble a combination of cards that allows the player to generate a large amount of mana quickly and cast a spell like Ad Nauseam or Tendrils of Agony to win the game in a single turn. This deck focuses on casting multiple spells in a single turn to build up storm count, which increases the power of cards like Tendrils of Agony. The deck includes a variety of fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond, along with cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to dig for key combo pieces.

The main focus of this deck is to generate mana and draw cards quickly using cards like Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith to assemble a combo that allows for powerful plays, such as casting Craterhoof Behemoth to overwhelm opponents with a huge army of Elves. The deck also includes utility creatures like Wirewood Symbiote and Reclamation Sage to deal with threats while leveraging cards like Natural Order and Heritage Druid to fuel the Elf engine and finish the game quickly.

The deck aims to generate a large amount of mana quickly through cards like Dark Ritual and Rite of Flame, and then use that mana to cast multiple spells in a single turn to achieve a game-winning combo. It includes cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Infernal Tutor to help find key pieces of the combo efficiently. The Burning Wish cards allow the player to search their sideboard for additional combo pieces or answers to the opponent's strategy. The deck is highly focused on executing its combo as efficiently as possible to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while deploying aggressive threats to quickly close out the game. It utilizes cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Wasteland to slow down the opponent, while using Aether Vial and Stoneforge Mystic to efficiently put pressure on the board. The deck also includes powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice to further enhance its aggressive strategy. With a mixture of disruptive elements and resilient threats, the deck aims to control the game and secure a victory through calculated aggression.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's strategy with disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Sanctum Prelate, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Mirran Crusader and Palace Jailer. Using cards like Aether Vial and Stoneforge Mystic, the deck aims to quickly get threats on the board and equip them with powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice. The deck also utilizes land destruction with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port to further disrupt your opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck has ways to protect its own creatures with Giver of Runes and Flickerwisp.

The focus of this deck is to establish control through a combination of disruptive spells and efficient creatures. By using cards like Mox Diamond and Chalice of the Void to disrupt opponents' strategies, while utilizing powerful creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Plague Engineer to maintain board presence, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents. The inclusion of cards like Lingering Souls and Sylvan Library provide additional card advantage and flexibility, allowing the deck to adapt to different matchups and strategies. Mana denial with cards like Wasteland and efficient tutoring with Green Sun's Zenith further enhance the deck's ability to control the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the opponent through a combination of powerful planeswalkers, removal spells, and counterspells. By utilizing cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns, Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Dack Fayden, the deck aims to maintain board control and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, cards like Force of Will, Thoughtseize, and Assassin's Trophy give the deck the ability to answer threats efficiently. The inclusion of Tarmogoyf and Snapcaster Mage provides additional threats and recursion options, while cards like Punishing Fire and Plague Engineer help deal with creatures on the battlefield.

The main concept of this Dredge combo deck is to rapidly fill the graveyard with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, allowing you to repeatedly return powerful creatures like Ichorid and Prized Amalgam from the graveyard. By sacrificing creatures with Cabal Therapy and generating tokens with Bridge from Below, you can overwhelm your opponent with an army of creatures and use Dread Return to bring back game-winning threats like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. The deck aims to quickly build up a strong board presence and outpace your opponent before they can respond effectively.

The main focus of this UR Aggro Legacy deck is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures like Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, Dreadhorde Arcanist, and Delver of Secrets, while disrupting their game plan with countermagic like Force of Will, Daze, and Spell Pierce. By utilizing cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, Preordain, and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to maintain card advantage and control the tempo of the game. Additionally, the inclusion of Wasteland helps to disrupt the opponent's mana base, further solidifying its aggressive strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to apply pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, Hooting Mandrills, and Delver of Secrets while disrupting their game plan with cards like Stifle, Force of Will, Daze, and counterspells. Utilizing cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for threats and answers, the deck aims to control the board and win the game quickly through aggressive plays and tempo swings. Additionally, the inclusion of Wrenn and Six provides additional value and card advantage to help maintain momentum throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo, using cards like Vampire Hexmage, Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Duress, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Thoughtseize to protect the combo or disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to support the combo with Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth, as well as utility lands like Karakas and Wasteland. Additionally, the inclusion of Elvish Reclaimer provides additional consistency in finding the pieces needed to execute the combo.

Utilizing fast mana and discard spells to quickly fill the graveyard, this deck aims to cheat out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Elesh Norn onto the battlefield, often as early as turn 1 or 2. By combining cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Animate Dead, the deck is able to consistently reanimate threats and overwhelm opponents with its powerful creatures. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Cabal Therapy and Unmask while assembling the combo pieces needed to win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements such as counterspells, removal, and graveyard hate to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategies. It also utilizes key cards like Energy Field and Rest in Peace to create strong defensive positions while also generating advantage with card selection effects like Brainstorm and Ponder. The addition of win conditions like Keranos, God of Storms and Monastery Mentor ensures that the deck can close out games efficiently once it has established control. The mana base is carefully balanced to support the deck's strategy and allow for flexibility in casting spells.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on disruptive plays and efficient, aggressive creatures to pressure the opponent. It utilizes powerful spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its threats while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with Thoughtseize and Lightning Bolt. The deck aims to control the board early on with cheap interaction, then close out the game quickly with threats like Delver of Secrets and Gurmag Angler. Reanimate is included as a surprise finisher, while cards like Brainstorm and Preordain provide card selection to keep the deck running smoothly.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain early game pressure with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, while disrupting the opponent's strategy with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also focuses on mana denial with cards like Wasteland and strong card selection with Brainstorm and Ponder. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful Planeswalkers like Wrenn and Six and Oko, Thief of Crowns adds versatility to the strategy. The deck aims to control the game tempo and push for a quick victory through aggressive plays and disruption.
